lexUnit.name: murmur.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a murmur (low, continuous sound)

sentence.text: ` He loves you dearly , Wilson , " Mrs Browning murmured .
` I do n't like it , " Doyle murmured , watching the unnervingly silent van .
` You 'd be surprised , " he murmured .
“ Long , dark hair … young … beautiful , ” he murmured thoughtfully .
` So that 's all done , " murmured Lucy .
` It looks as if that car has come this way , " murmured Mary .
` Cynicism breeds loneliness , " murmured Urquhart .
` Impressed with the glamour ? " murmured Lucenzo , watching her intently .
` One day we 'll visit America , " murmured David , holding her close .
She apologized obliquely for her husband , and McLeish murmured that Mr Morgan had obviously been very much attached to Angela .
After the Oval Test David Gower murmured that West Indies must be ` quaking in their boots " at the thought of England 's forthcoming visit , a characteristically ironic piece of Gower humour .
People murmured that this would never have happened in Cromwell 's day , albeit secretly for fear of the authorities .
` A pity , " Bruce murmured so quietly that Corbett could hardly hear him .
The editor gulped and murmured that perhaps he had been mistaken .
Her husband , taking his cue , murmured that nothing would surprise him nowadays .
Their doctor had murmured something about a weak heart , but Lord Grafton had dismissed the warning , saying the physician was an old woman .
I felt like murmuring the verses about Judas going out and hanging himself , and that he should go and do likewise , but Benjamin looked so quietly pleased with himself that I bit my tongue .
Frau Geller murmured something to her companion about it never happening to a woman unless she 'd been asking for it .
He put his hands out to take up the carving knife and fork and Amy Hall murmured something to her neighbour about Arthur always having wanted to be a surgeon really .
She murmured something to him , some affirmation of love , and he felt the vibration of her voice strike through him .
` Looks like an Easter egg , " murmured Busacher to himself and heard a snort behind him .
The animal fidgeted , but calmed down at once when he murmured a few words to it .
Lucker murmurs something to Jasper and leads him away closing the door on me .
At the reception desk , he murmured a few words to the elaborately uniformed commissionaire and was shown respectfully towards the lift .
Dave murmurs something along the lines of how she seems to be coping with it very well .
At the table the young man murmured his pleasure at something Father Reynard had pointed out , shook the priest 's hand and quickly left .
Bernice heard Ace murmur something beneath her breath .
The Princess stirred and murmured something in her sleep .
For a second he looked exasperated and then he murmured something in his own language and suddenly drew her to her feet , his hands gripping hers , steadying her and comforting .
Everyone murmured awkward disclaimers except Alexandra , who , seething with embarrassment , now found herself seated next to Matthew .
I thought the best thing to do was spare Oliver 's blushes , so I murmured something about getting off to work .
Zen murmured something about needing to find his mother a present , and Cinzia immediately took charge .
The group round about murmured their agreement .
Oh , yes , I am sure he was most impolite , " she hurried on as Melissa murmured a conventional disclaimer .
The mother opened and closed her hand and circled it over that bowed head , cracking her knuckles , and she was also murmuring some incantation .
Merrill murmured her thanks , and then she was alone in the office with Luke .
The reply was murmured into the string of turquoise shark 's teeth she wore round her neck .
The words were murmured through the man 's moustache , so softly they found no echo in the interview room .
Claudia murmured agreement and ate automatically , though she could n't taste a thing .
Frere murmured an apology which Horrocks hastily dismissed .
Melissa murmured some banal phrases of encouragement and put down the telephone with a feeling of desolation .
She murmured something he could n't catch and flung her leg over his .
So she murmured soothing words and patted Eleanor 's shoulder until , little by little , the rocking and moaning subsided like the vibration of a spring coming to rest .
At night , as they huddled round their fires , the people would murmur about the evil spirit who kicked holes in their kilns so that they had to buy their bricks from Dai Huang .
Every few years , people in industrial circles murmur about what would happen if supplies were cut off , for political or commercial reasons .
De Gaulle , who had never murmured about leaking taps or malodorous drains , remained somewhat out of favour with the group for the short time remaining .
` Hurry up with the wine , " he murmured to the butler .
Now Charles murmured quietly to Clarissa .
As they left Dora Hassock murmured to her guests , ` I went in to see Mr Jason today , he 's much better .
` She 'd have been better with someone nearer her own age , " the old woman murmured to herself .
` She always was , " Constance murmured to herself .
She murmured to him and put her hand over his .
` Oi , gevald , " Joshua murmured to himself , unable to suppress the age-old cry of suffering and despair as he momentarily covered his eyes with his hand .
` My , my " he murmured to himself and , bowing , he announced , ` Freeman Tucker .
" Siddown , ye great daft bugger , " he murmured with affection .
` A very ambiguous statement , " he murmured in amusement .
Two young women in front of her were murmuring confidentially .
Tom murmured mildly , and a bubble of laughter rose to Belinda 's lips .
It was a grim sort of place , and Bunting felt uneasy as a group of workmen began to stare at them and murmur ominously .
Forster , still inching aside , murmured sympathetically .
The crowd murmured uneasily .
Stephanie lowered the book and murmured .
Luke put in softly , his quirked eyebrows lending a deeper , more personal value to the words , and Merrill found the opportunity to murmur ,
Julie murmured , struggling not to laugh .
` That young man will advance far , " Cranston murmured as they dismounted and knocked on the door .
Now do stop murmuring .
